results.title: QED: a guide to Armageddon
results.brief_description: A simulated nuclear explosion in London with realistic special effects provides a frank and disturbing look at the effects of the bomb and the implications for survival.

results.title: Qantas: I Still Call Australia Home [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
Over twenty years, Qantas has produced a series of commercials featuring the Peter Allen song ‘I Still Call Australia Home’. This is the original mid 1980s version.
Produced by Mojo MDA.

results.title: Pythagoras in 3D
results.brief_description: Illustrates a celebrated proof of Pythagoras’s theorem by Tarbit of Baghdad in the ninth century and by Leonardo da Vinci in the fifteenth century. Considers some cases of calculation by Pythagoras’s rule, arising from three-dimensional situations.

results.title: Pythagoras
results.brief_description: Points out the simplest Pythagorean triple (3,4,5,), demonstrating its use by the ancient Egyptians in surveying boundaries after the annual Nile floods. Raises the question as to whether the theorem holds true for the right-angled trianlges other than isosceles ones and presents a proof. From the series “Vision in Mathematics”.

results.title: Pyongyang diaries
results.brief_description: This documentary records Hoaas’ personal encounter with the closed society of North Korea (the Democratic Peoples Republic of Korea). In a landscape replete with showcase monuments and bombastic images of progress, the film explores these images as a presentation of an idealised reality, and between them, forms an image of the people through observations, conversations, and personal diary reflections on other experiences at the time of filming. As with her earlier work, Hoaas approaches her film as a cumulation of fragments encompassing different perspectives that together offer a point of entry into a complex society. Her diary-style narration signals her limited personal perspective into this culture, especially given the brief filming period and her difficulty in breaking through the facade of the showcase version of Korea insisted upon by her official guides. Hoaas’ restricted visual access, and her reluctance to present over-familiar images of the hardship and depravation informed her decision to use this narrative device to frame her film within the context of the famine crisis that began in 1997 following the failure of crops caused by two consecutive years of heavy flooding. Reference: Hoaas, Solrun. ‘Pyongyang Diaries: director’s notes’ Documenter Vol. 4 No. 1 March 2001. http://www.documenter.com/back011/011hoaaa.htm

results.title: Pygmies of the Ituri Forest
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Hallet and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Records the many aspects of the life of the Efe Pygmies of Zaire, Africa. Pygmies cease to grow after eight - nine years but they also mature incredibly quickly and are ready for marriage at this age. Looks at thier ceremonies and rituals and at exploitation and destruction of their home forest.

results.title: Pygmies of Africa
results.brief_description: Depicts phases of pygmy life in the Congo River region of Central Africa including gathering of food, hunting methods, bartering processes, witch doctor mysticism and native superstitions.
results.description: Depicts phases of pygmy life in the Congo River region of Central Africa including gathering of food, hunting methods, bartering processes, witch doctor mysticism and native superstitions.

results.title: Pygmalion
results.creator_credit: Gabriel Pascal, Pascal Film Productions, Anthony Asquith and Leslie Howard
results.brief_description: When Bernard Shaw saw this film of his play Pygmalion, he said to Wendy Hiller who plays Eliza Doolittle, “You’ve nearly wiped my old play off the map.” And you will be impressed and moved by her wonderful portrayal of one of the most famous characters in 20th century theatre. Leslie Howard who co-directed the film with Anthony Asquith, gives a fresh, witty and incisive performance as Professor Higgins.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gabriel Pascal, Pascal Film Productions, Anthony Asquith and Leslie Howard
